item.title: Measuring NC job loss from Covid-19
item.description: Over the past four weeks, more than 20 million people have filed for unenmployment as the country adjusts economic fallout of Covid-19. While we still donâ€™t know the longterm impacts of the pandemic, swift and widespread job loss puts pressure on millions of Americans rising medical, housing, and school-related costs. In mid-April the Urban Institute released new estimates of the number of low-income jobs (<$40k salary) lost as a result of Covid-19.
